title: Eravikulam National Park
description: Home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr, this park offers stunning trekking routes through rolling grasslands and shola forests. It's the highest peak in South India.

title: TATA Tea Museum
description: Discover the history of tea cultivation in Munnar. Witness the journey from leaf plucking to the final processing stage, complete with tastings.

title: Mattupetty Dam & Lake
description: A concrete gravity dam built for water conservation and power generation. The calm lake offers speed boating and is often visited by wild elephants.

title: Edakkal Cave
description: Explore ancient Neolithic-era rock carvings inside a natural cave on Ambukuthi Mala. A short, moderately challenging trek leads to the entrance.

title: Soochipara Waterfalls (Sentinel Rock Falls)
description: A stunning three-tiered waterfall surrounded by dense green forest, perfect for trekking down to the pool for a refreshing dip.

title: Chembra Peak
description: The highest peak in Wayanad, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding area. The trail includes the famous heart-shaped Hridaya Thadakam lake.

title: Fort Kochi
description: Explore the colonial heritage area with Portuguese, Dutch, and British architectural influences, including St. Francis Church and colorful streets.

title: Chinese Fishing Nets
description: Witness the iconic, cantilevered fishing nets in action at sunset along the coast of Fort Kochi, a unique sight brought by Chinese traders.

title: Jew Town & Paradesi Synagogue
description: Wander through the historic lane of antique shops in Jew Town, leading to the beautifully preserved 16th-century Paradesi Synagogue.

title: Lighthouse Beach
description: The main crescent-shaped beach of Kovalam, famed for the striped lighthouse that provides panoramic views of the coast.

title: Hawa Beach (Eve’s Beach)
description: A quieter, slightly secluded stretch of golden sand adjacent to Lighthouse Beach, popular for morning walks and peaceful sunbathing.

title: Samudra Beach
description: The northernmost beach, separated by a promontory. It's often less crowded and frequented by local fishermen, offering an authentic coastal scene.

title: Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Home to elephants, tigers, and diverse birdlife. The best way to explore is via a boat ride on the Periyar Lake, where animals come to drink.

title: Spice Plantations Tours
description: Walk through lush farms to learn about the cultivation of cardamom, pepper, cinnamon, and cloves, and enjoy the exotic aromas.

title: Kadathanadan Kalari Centre
description: Experience a thrilling evening performance of Kalaripayattu, the ancient martial art form of Kerala, showcasing incredible agility and skill.

title: Top Station Viewpoint
description: The highest point in Munnar offering a panoramic vista of the Western Ghats and the neighboring state of Tamil Nadu. Perfect for sunrises.

title: Lakkam Waterfalls
description: A stunning, pristine waterfall originating from the Eravikulam Plateau. The water cascades down rocky cliffs near the Marayoor region.

title: Kolukkumalai Tea Estate Trek
description: Visit the world's highest organic tea plantation. The journey requires an off-road jeep trip and rewards you with spectacular views and a vintage factory tour.

title: Anayirangal Dam & Reservoir
description: Located amidst dense tea plantations, this reservoir is a tranquil spot. 'Anayirangal' means 'where the elephants come down'—a common sighting area.

title: Marayoor Sandalwood Forest
description: The only natural sandalwood forest in Kerala. Explore the protected groves and learn about the rare, aromatic wood.

title: Pothamedu Viewpoint
description: Offers expansive views of the surrounding coffee, tea, and cardamom plantations. A great spot for light trekking and watching the mist roll in.

title: Attukal Waterfalls
description: A stunning cascade located between Munnar and Pallivasal. Its high volume makes it an impressive sight, especially after the monsoon.

title: Banasura Sagar Dam
description: India's largest earth dam and the second largest in Asia. It features numerous small islands and offers speed boating and serene views.

title: Pookode Lake
description: A natural freshwater lake nestled among forested hills. Ideal for paddle boating, fishing, and visiting the adjacent freshwater aquarium.

title: Kuruva Island
description: A protected river delta on the Kabini River, known for its dense population of flora and fauna. Accessed via bamboo rafting or ferry.

title: Thirunelli Temple
description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, known as the 'Kasi of the South.' It is beautifully situated among the Brahmagiri hills.

title: Wayanad Heritage Museum
description: Houses an extensive collection of tribal artifacts, including ancient tools, weaponry, and pottery, offering insight into Wayanad's indigenous culture.

title: Lakkidi View Point
description: The gateway to Wayanad, offering a magnificent aerial view of the serpentine ghat road, deep valleys, and the surrounding lush hills.

title: Phantom Rock (Cheengeri Mala)
description: A unique skull-shaped rock formation created by natural geological processes, popular for trekking and photography in the Wayanad hills.

title: Karapuzha Dam
description: One of the largest earth dams in India. The surrounding wetlands are a haven for various species of migratory birds.

title: Hill Palace Museum
description: The largest archaeological museum in Kerala, this former administrative office and royal residence of the Kochi Maharaja houses hundreds of artifacts and crowns.

title: Marine Drive
description: A popular waterfront promenade facing the backwaters. Famous for its spectacular views of the sunset and the bustling Kochi Harbor.

title: Santa Cruz Cathedral Basilica
description: One of the nine basilicas in Kerala, known for its stunning Gothic architecture and historical significance dating back to the Portuguese era.

title: Kerala Folklore Museum
description: A three-story building showcasing the architectural style of Kerala, housing over 4,000 artifacts, masks, and traditional art forms.

title: Vasco da Gama Square
description: A beautiful promenade in Fort Kochi, known for the Chinese Fishing Nets and small shops selling fresh catch and spices.

title: Mattancherry Palace (Dutch Palace)
description: Known for its exquisite murals depicting scenes from the Hindu epics, Ramayana and Mahabharata. Built by the Portuguese and renovated by the Dutch.

title: Backwater Cruise to Vypeen Island
description: Take a ferry across the backwaters to Vypeen Island, offering serene views, local life, and access to Cherai Beach.

title: Pardesi Synagogue
description: The oldest active synagogue in the Commonwealth, located in Jew Town. Famous for its exquisite Chinese porcelain tiles and Belgian chandeliers.

title: Wonderla Amusement Park
description: A large and popular amusement park offering high-thrill rides, water slides, and family-friendly entertainment, located just outside the city.

title: Kathakali Performance Center
description: Witness the vibrant and traditional classical Kerala dance-drama, Kathakali, including the elaborate make-up process before the show.

title: Vizhinjam Lighthouse
description: Climb the red-and-white striped lighthouse on Lighthouse Beach for spectacular 360-degree views of the Kovalam coastline and Arabian Sea.

title: Chowara Beach
description: A quiet, unspoiled stretch of golden sand south of Kovalam, known for its small fishing village and the ancient Chowara Ayyappa Temple on a hillock.

title: Thiruvallam Backwaters
description: Located close to Kovalam, this spot offers serene canoeing, kayaking, and houseboat rides away from the main tourist bustle.

title: Valiathura Pier
description: An old, abandoned pier extending 700 feet into the sea. A popular spot for local fishermen and an excellent place for quiet viewing.

title: Aazhimala Siva Temple
description: Famous for its massive, imposing, and intricately carved 58-foot tall statue of Lord Shiva in the Gangadhareshwara form, overlooking the sea.

title: Vellayani Lake
description: The largest freshwater lake in Thiruvananthapuram district. Best visited during the annual Onam boat race.

title: Ashoka Beach (South Kovalam)
description: Tucked away near the main crescent beaches, offering more privacy and a beautiful, rocky coastline ideal for photography.

title: Karamana River
description: Offers tranquil country boat rides along the river banks, showcasing traditional Kerala village life and coconut groves.

title: Vizhinjam Rock Cut Cave Temple
description: A small 8th-century rock-cut temple that houses a single cell with a sculpture of Lord Shiva and an unfinished relief of the Hindu Goddess Durga.

title: Kovalam Fish Market
description: Experience the local fishing culture, where fishermen sell their morning catch directly on the beach. Great for fresh seafood lovers.

title: Gavi Eco-Tourism
description: An intense jungle safari experience through dense, evergreen forest. Offers off-road jeep safaris, bamboo rafting, and stay packages.

title: Mangala Devi Kannagi Temple
description: An ancient temple dedicated to the goddess Kannagi, situated in a remote spot on the border of Kerala and Tamil Nadu. Open only once a year.

title: The Bamboo Rafting Program
description: A full-day eco-tourism program involving trekking through dense forest followed by a unique bamboo raft ride across the Periyar Lake.

title: Murikkady Spice Plantations
description: Known for its sprawling coffee and cardamom plantations. Visitors can take guided walks to learn about the entire spice growing and processing cycle.

title: Chellarkovil Viewpoint
description: Located high up in the hills, this point offers a stunning panoramic view of the cascading waterfalls and the plains of Tamil Nadu.

title: Thekkady Elephant Junction
description: Offers various elephant interaction activities, including riding, bathing, and feeding the gentle giants in a natural setting.

title: Pullumedu Hill Station
description: Famous for its beautiful meadows, rolling hills, and rare flora. Access is often restricted, but the surrounding views are exceptional.

title: Vandiperiyar
description: Famous for pepper and coffee cultivation along the Periyar riverbanks. A great place to experience the local planting and harvesting processes.

title: Pandalasala Local Crafts Center
description: A center for local artisans where you can find handmade crafts, spices, and unique souvenirs from the Thekkady region.

title: Border Hiking (Periyar Tiger Reserve)
description: A specialized, intense, and guided trekking program offered by the forest department, following the boundaries of the tiger reserve.
